data.fullContent: An early clash between them, which occurred shortly after Jefferson took office as secretary of state, led to a new and profoundly important interpretation of the Constitution. When Hamilton introduced his bill to establish a national bank, Jefferson, speaking for those who believed in states ' rights, argued that the Constitution expressly enumerated all the powers belonging to the federal government and reserved all other powers to the states. Nowhere was the federal government empowered to set up a bank.
data.answer: 他们之间的早期冲突发生在杰斐逊就任国务卿后不久，导致了对宪法的新而深刻的重要解释。当汉密尔顿提出建立国家银行的法案时，杰弗逊站在那些相信各州权利的人的立场上说，宪法明确地列出了属于联邦政府的所有权力，而保留了属于各州的所有其他权力。联邦政府无权设立银行。
